content:
Sorry, I should also add that even when I move an email (say from Gmail) to a local folder, another copy is created in the Inbox, so I now have two copies.

Also, I can't move emails into certain folders when using the PC version of Thunderbird but I can do this when using the iOS version. What gives?

content: I have to correct what I said previously. None of my accounts are now working correctly. Just sits there and the bottom status line states it's checking things or trying to sync, etc. How can I get my email client working again? Why would you release a product that hasn't been fully tested ?
creator: paul.sage65

content: It looks like any email account that requires OAuth2 isn't working now. I have one account that doesn't use OAuth2 and it works. What is the work around?
creator: paul.sage65

content: Solved the issue. Just needed to find the saved passwords under Settings and Privacy & Security. I removed ALL the passwords. Exited Thunderbird and made sure it was closed in the Task Manager. Then opened Thunderbird and entered the passwords again as they were requested.
creator: paul.sage65

content: Does it work if you eliminate the space in the name, e.g. Signatures_2024?
creator: sfhowes

content:
There's some work on this here:

https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1482172

In the meantime, there is a way to make the card background colour the same as the colour of the tag assigned to a message, so if custom tags were created for each account, messages could be tagged with a filter, one for each account.
creator: sfhowes

content:
You have to change the server settings and authentication method:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/microsoft-oauth-authentication-and-thunderbird-202
